question: Two similar galvanometers are converted into an ammeter and a milliammeter. The shunt resistance of ammeter as compared to the shunt resistance of milliammeter will be
explanation: For Ammeter, range I is large (e.g., 1A). For Milliammeter, range I is small (e.g., 1mA).
Since S is inversely proportional to <katex>$(I - I_g)$</katex>, a larger Range I requires a smaller Shunt S.
